channel.title: OAuth and OIDC Explained on DevDocs Navigation Menu Test
channel.description: Recent content in OAuth and OIDC Explained on DevDocs Navigation Menu Test

item.title: Flows (grant types)
item.description: Flows (grant types) Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Structure type: Navigation Content type: Dynamic Index A dynamic index is an automatically generated list of links to topics immediately beneath it based purely on the site’s structure, or with some level of filtering. A blind list of summaries and links to child docs. For example: https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/authorization/ https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/api-security/ https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/manage-users/

item.title: Authorization servers
item.description: Authorization servers Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Links to original docs: - Authorization servers: https://developer.okta.com/docs/concepts/auth-servers/ Structure type: Concept Content type: Conceptual overview Conceptual overviews present a high-level introduction to a topic.Â For example, there are product \ feature overviews: https://developer.okta.com/docs/concepts/multi-tenancy/ https://developer.okta.com/docs/concepts/scim/ https://developer.okta.com/docs/concepts/auth-servers/ And there are also overviews of lower-level material. For example: The Client Credentials Flow: Taking this material from the top to “Set Up Your App”.

item.title: Access, Id,and refresh tokens
item.description: Access, Id,and refresh tokens Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Description: Overview of Access, Id and refresh tokens. Links to original docs: Some content for the new doc originating from: Refresh access tokens: https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/refresh-tokens/main/ Possible Access and ID token content is in other docs as well Why is this here?: - Group results showed authorization server is a “no consensus” term, which may indicate term confusion and/or differing interpretations by respondents.

item.title: JWTS explained
item.description: JSON web tokens explained Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Description: Overview of JSON web tokens. Why is this here?: - External Oktane 2023 - MatchIt: 21% of respondents got JWTs incorrect in the MatchIt exercise. External Oktane 2023 - GroupIt: 9.3% were unable to categorize JSON web token Respondents placed JSON web tokens under the broad APIS and SDKs group at 48.
